title: Is it difficult to sing well? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. Even those with a natural talent for singing have to learn correct technique, which can only really be taught/coached. It definitely helps to have knowledge of musical theory, but it isn’t essential. There are a few essential things to learn about in order to become a ‘serious’ singer: Breath control. I cannot emphasise enough how important this is. I also can’t emphasise enough how much you don’t realise how important this is until you start to do it properly. It unlocks parts of your voice you didn’t know were there.Tone and timbre. This is all to do with the unique characteristics of your voice, which, once you master Breath Control, you will have a lot more control over.Vocal styling. You should be aware of the kind of music you’re singing, and make appropriate stylisations to suit. You wouldn’t sing barbershop quartet music in the same way you’d sing a pop song - a pop song has much more scope for ad-hoc decoration.Visual presentation and styling. Again, different styles of music and performance settings require different visual styles. I find this particularly difficult to master as it’s easy to just look as if you’re concentrating on singing correctly!There are loads more techniques that will be specific to the genre/style, but singers train, practice, and get coaching for years in order to get to where they are. Even raw talent isn’t necessarily enough to get you very far without some basic skill work.

Is it hard to sing well? Not if you do it every day. The one thing I know that would help someone starting out is projecting their voice. You’ve got to really connect with the notes. You should treat it like any instrument, and if you want to be great it would be good to find someone who knows what they’re doing. If you plan on learning stuff like the right techniques, sight-singing, improvisation, it’s really best to have someone who is competent enough to teach it to you.
